conclusion: Analyze image to determine which container liquid from A, B, C, D will flow into.
Four liquid sources labeled A, B, C, D with colors blue, yellow, green, orange.
Several slanted baffles in the middle to direct liquid flow.
Three containers labeled E, F, G with colors yellow, brown, blue.
Liquid flows downward due to gravity and baffles redirect flow based on angles.
Blue baffle below A and B slants downward to the right.
Brown baffle below blue baffle slants downward to the left.
Gray baffle below C slants downward to the left.
Black baffle below D slants downward to the right.
Trace path of liquid from each source A, B, C, D through baffles to containers.
Source A is on the left side.
Liquid from A hits blue baffle and flows right.
Liquid from A misses brown and black baffles, falls into container G.
Source B is slightly to the right of A.
Liquid from B hits blue baffle and flows right like A.
Liquid from B misses brown and black baffles, falls into container G.
Source C is to the right of B.
Liquid from C hits gray baffle and flows left.
Liquid from C hits brown baffle, continues left, falls into container E.
Source D is on the far right.
Liquid from D hits black baffle, flows right, falls off edge into container G.
Summarize paths: A and B flow into G, C flows into E, D flows into G.
Check for overlaps or missed containers: E receives C, F receives none, G receives A, B, D.
Final answer: Liquid from A, B, D flows into G; liquid from C flows into E.
